instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 3× <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ASD 3S146 OS freeze on RAM test
threads.message:
Hi,
When running ASD 3S146 OS on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boards, it freezes on the first RAM test "Apple 64 Memory Address As Data test".
3 different boards do the same, so I'm wondering if it's an issue with ASD itself or something I overlooked.
If I skip that test, it freezes on the next RAM test. If I skip them all it completes.
On one board I ran Memtest and it passed the 4 passes. ASD 3S146 EFI passes as well, and macOS 10.13 boots, appears to be working fine but haven't tested extensively yet.
ASD downloaded from the usual Russian torrent.

Anyone encountered this issue on ASD OS already?

threads.title: 3× <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ASD 3S146 OS freeze on RAM test
threads.message:
I don't normally run ASD OS versions.
I have a stick with 15 ASDs, all EFI versions.
Even ASD EFI, I use unmarking SSD and RAM tests.

Did you ever find/solved any problem with an OS version, instead of EFI?
ASD OS can be usefull to test GPU on discrete boards.

threads.title: 3× <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ASD 3S146 OS freeze on RAM test
threads.message: It's not uncommon to have RAM issues on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, I want to make sure everything works properly and that freeze on the RAM test has me worried, that's all.

threads.title: 3× <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ASD 3S146 OS freeze on RAM test
threads.message: Yeah, I saw several 3023 with RAM issues; but you should be able to detect it with extensive tests under macOS.
